sentences.english: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.
sentences.chinese: 现今都比海沙更重，所以我的言语急躁。
要尽量控制住你的急躁情绪。

sentences.english: Your partner may be somewhat irritable this week.
sentences.chinese: 本周你的伴侣会有些急躁。

sentences.english: He tossed fretfully and could not get to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 但是东想西想，急躁地翻来覆去终夜不能入眠。

sentences.english: "A whole nation of belligerent, snappish people?" asked Nikolai.
sentences.chinese: “一个全国好战的国家？急躁的人民？”尼可莱问。

sentences.english: Home to a strong earthquake, the people working outside Xinjirufen.
sentences.chinese: 家乡遭受强烈地震，在外做工的人心里急躁如焚。

sentences.english: He was also very impatient, he couldn't wait for anything.
sentences.chinese: 他性情急躁，对任何事情都没有耐心。

sentences.english: I said the wrong thing, acted too desperate, or wasn’t interested enough.
sentences.chinese: 我说错话，表现急躁，或者心不在焉。

sentences.english: IrritaBly, she elBowed a path through the streams of girls entering and leaving the gate.
sentences.chinese: 她急躁地从进进出出的姑娘群中拨开一条道。

sentences.english: Magnitsky began to make fun of Stolypin's earnestness.
sentences.chinese: 马格尼茨基开始取笑斯托雷平的急躁情绪。

sentences.english: He exclaimed, still excited, willing to be angry at anyone for the moment .
sentences.chinese: 他嚷道，还是急躁得很，一时很想找什么人出出气。

sentences.english: On his bench in Madison Square Soapy moved uneasily.
sentences.chinese: 索比急躁不安地躺在麦迪逊广场的长凳上。

sentences.english: Inevitability and temperament are two hallmarks of Gates the innovator.
sentences.chinese: 强势和急躁是盖茨作为革新者的两个商标。
雷斯上校急躁地骂开了。

sentences.english: Sugar gives a temporary rush of energy, then leaves you tired and irritable.
sentences.chinese: 糖能提供一时的能量，然后就让你感到疲倦和急躁。

sentences.english: Sorrow makes us go slower and more considerately , and introspect our motives and dispositions.
sentences.chinese: 忧愁也使我们不急躁，认准动机和目标。

definition: to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
